title: How France's fixation with decline serves the Trumpian narrative
subhed: As the threat posed by the United States grows, narratives of decline have gained traction in France, setting the stage for a presidential campaign centered on the power of France and Europe.

title: Quinn Slobodian: 'The US discarding the post-1945 international system is a bold and reckless gamble'
subhed: The Trump administration stubbornly believes that the only way for the US to regain its lost greatness is through regional, rather than global, supremacy, analyzes the specialist in global history.

title: NATO, Greenland vow to boost Arctic security after Trump threats
subhed: Following President Trump's threat on Sunday to take Greenland 'one way or another,' NATO and Greenland's government are intending to strengthen the territory's defense.

title: Real Madrid fires Xabi Alonso and names Alvaro Arbeloa as coach
subhed: Real Madrid parted ways with the Spanish coach and named former defender Alvaro Arbeloa as his replacement, a day after losing the Spanish Super Cup final to Barcelona.

title: Exclusive images: On the set of 'Marty Supreme,' Timothée Chalamet dominates the game
subhed: In 'Marty Supreme,' directed by Josh Safdie, Timothée Chalamet plays Marty Mauser, a character inspired by the 1950s table tennis star Marty Reisman. With a Golden Globe win, the role cements the 30-year-old as one of the greatest actors of his generation. Photographer Tim El Kaïm had exclusive access to the set of this highly anticipated film, which is set for release in France in February.

The British seniors trading tea dances at a daring cabaret
subhed: Once a month at London's The Posh Club, burlesque acts and striptease in a nightclub atmosphere delight Brits over 60, who let loose until late in the afternoon.

title: 'Don't forget you saved my life': Letter to the stranger who gave me their bone marrow
subhed: Hélène Schlesinger was 37 and had a husband, two children, and plenty of plans for the future when she learned, in 2022, that she had leukemia. For months, the young woman fought as she waited for a bone marrow transplant. She lives thanks to an anonymous donor. All she knows is that he is German and that a part of him now lives inside her.

title: The Ukrainian-held Donbas, a land of ruins and grief
subhed: This region in eastern Ukraine now has only 200,000 inhabitants, compared to five million before the Russian invasion of 2022. Le Monde visited the area still under Kyiv's authority.
